title: Risk Management
description: Identifying, analyzing, and responding to project risks throughout the project lifecycle

pmbok.excerpt: Risk management includes the processes of conducting risk management planning, identifying risks, performing risk analysis, planning risk responses, implementing risk responses, and monitoring risks.

prince2.excerpt: The purpose of the Risk theme is to identify, assess and control uncertainty and, as a result, improve the ability of the project to succeed.

iso21500.excerpt: Risk management should be an integral part of project management and decision-making processes.

title: Stakeholder Management
description: Identifying, analyzing, and engaging project stakeholders effectively

pmbok.excerpt: Stakeholder management includes the processes required to identify the people, groups, or organizations that could impact or be impacted by the project.

prince2.excerpt: The Organization theme defines and establishes the project's structure of accountability and responsibilities.

iso21500.excerpt: Project stakeholders should be identified and their needs, expectations and influence on the project should be understood and managed.

title: Quality Management
description: Ensuring project deliverables meet specified requirements and standards

pmbok.excerpt: Quality management includes the processes for incorporating the organization's quality policy regarding planning, managing, and controlling project and product quality requirements.

prince2.excerpt: The purpose of the Quality theme is to define and implement the means by which the project will create and verify products that are fit for purpose.

iso21500.excerpt: Quality management should ensure that the project will satisfy the needs for which it was undertaken.

title: Scope Management
description: Defining and controlling what is and is not included in the project

pmbok.excerpt: Scope management includes the processes required to ensure that the project includes all the work required, and only the work required, to complete the project successfully.

prince2.excerpt: The project scope defines the boundaries of the project and what will and will not be delivered.

iso21500.excerpt: The project scope should be defined, documented, verified and controlled throughout the project life cycle.

title: Schedule Management
description: Planning, developing, and controlling the project schedule

pmbok.excerpt: Schedule management includes the processes required to manage the timely completion of the project.

prince2.excerpt: The purpose of the Plans theme is to facilitate communication and control by defining the means of delivering the products.

iso21500.excerpt: Time management should ensure timely completion of the project through appropriate processes for planning, monitoring and controlling time-related activities.
